name: 3DAmnesic
headline: PoC MP4 video player.
author: Lectem
description: Plays a mpeg4 or h264 video, the file has to be named test.mp4 and be placed at the root of your SD card.

name: 3DSController
headline: Connects the 3DS to a PC via wifi to be used as a controller.
author: CTurt
description: A 3DS homebrew application which allows you to use your 3DS as a wireless controller for Windows.

name: 3DS Binary to Decimal Converter
headline: Converts an entered binary number to its decimal equivalent.
author: AlbertoSONIC
description: With this app you can easily convert decimal numbers to binary, as well as binary numbers to decimal! It's easy to use, just click numbers on the bottom touch screen! You will instantanely get the converted value! Up to 20 bits!

name: Braindump
headline: Dump a game's contents to the SD card.
author: neobrain
description: Braindump is a 3DS homebrew application that can dump 3DS titles, i.e. cartridge and eShop games, but also other installed content. Since it runs entirely in userland, it runs on any system version supported by the Homebrew Launcher. The dumps created by braindump are lossy, since not all title information is accessible to userland applications. braindump compensates for that by generating fake metadata using clever heuristics. This is good enough to be able to run the dumped title in an emulator or to title contents (artwork, sounds, etc) for ROM hacking.

name: BootAnim9
headline: Loads and plays custom animations from SD card during boot. For arm9loaderhax.
author: Wolfvak

name: The Homebrew Launcher
headline: Oficial Ninjhax Homebrew Launcher.
author: smealum, fincs
description: The Homebrew Launcher is the default menu for ninjhax, a 3DS homebrew-enabling exploit released on November 20th 2014. It is a fairly simple (and beautiful) menu that lists homebrew applications and lets you run them.

name: Homebrew Launcher Loader
headline: 3DS NCCH application for booting the *hax payloads.
author: yellows8
description: 3DS homebrew application intended booting the *hax payloads. This will first attempt to load the payload from SD, if that isn't successful it will then automatically download the payload for your system with HTTP.

name: HANS
headline: Apply runtime patches to a selected title, allowing for mods and region free.
author: smealum

name: CTRXplorer
headline: Open source SD file manager for the 3DS.
author: d0k3
description: CTRXplorer is an open source SD file manager with simple hex viewer. Its goal is to be a simple, functional tool for managing your files without any unneeded bloat.

name: Custom Home Menu Manager (CHMM)
headline: Theme Manager for custom themes for Nintendo 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante
description: CHMM2 is a theme manager for 3DS for custom themes; it works under lpp-3ds and it is completely opensource.

name: Decrypt9
headline: Multipurpose content dumper and decryptor for the Nintendo 3DS.
author: Archshift, d0k3

name: EmuNAND9
headline: SD card formatter and emuNAND manager.
author: d0k3
description: Open source EmuNAND SD formatter & manager for the 3DS console aka. "The final nail in the coffin of GW software for GW non-owners'

name: Sunshell
tags: utilities, multimedia, files, system, LUA, ARM11, userland, kernel
headline: Multifunction shell written in LUA.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Sunshell is a shell inspired by Ahman work on PSP with irShell. It's coded in C and LUA and it provides a modules system. Any developer can easily add their homebrews (both C and LUA homebrews) to Sunshell modules so their applications will be shown in Sunshell Main Menu. Final goal for this homebrew is to provide an universal alternative menu for 3DS.

name: FBI
headline: Open source title manager for the 3DS.
author: Steveice10

name: GYTB
headline: Generates custom home menu badges from PNG files.
author: MrCheeze
description: Just add the badges you want as 64x64 PNGs in the badges folder, and run the homebrew to transfer them to your home menu. Larger images (e.g. 64x128) will automatically be split. Running Badge Arcade to set up the extdata is not required, so players stuck without eShop access should still be able to use this normally. However, a firmware of 9.3 or above is still necessary.

name: JK's Save Manager
headline: User-friendly savedata manager.
author: J-D-K
description: This is a save manager you can install as a CIA. This means no more booting into the homebrew menu and rebooting to import and export saves.

name: Gimme 300 coins
headline: Sets your play coin counter to 300 then exits.
author: Howling Wolf, Chelsea_Fantasy
description: Say hello to "Gimme 300 coins!", the simplest tool to obtain 300 coins. Just, open it and done! 300 coins and back to your HOME Menu.

name: Useless Homebrew
headline: What does it do? Find out by yourself.
author: FUK-Team
description: This is a port of the "Useless Homebrew" written for the DS by Rydian. It's a digital version of the "Useless Machine" which powers itself off.

name: GodMode9
headline: SD & NAND file manager.
author: d0k3
description: GodMode9 is a full access file browser for the Nintendo 3DS console, giving you access to your SD card and to the FAT partitons inside your SysNAND and EmuNAND. As of now, you can copy, delete, rename files and create folders. A write permission system prevents you from doing dangerous stuff without noticing.

name: Menuhax Manager
headline: Installer and manager for the menuhax exploit.
author: yellows8

name: Sploit installer
headline: Installer for the ironhax and oothax exploits.
author: smealum

name: Salt sploit installer
headline: Installer for the supermysterychunkhax, (v*)hax and humblehax exploits.
author: SALT Team
description: This exists to distribute 3DS userland exploits developed by the SALT team for booting the homebrew launcher (*hax).

name: Region free launcher (regionFOUR)
headline: Allows for out of region gamecards to be launched on any 3DS.
author: smealum

name: Regionthree
headline: Allows for out of region gamecards to be launched on any 3DS.
author: smealum
description: Region free loader for 3DS/3DSXL/2DS on firmware versions 4.0 to 9.5.0-22. Loads games from other regions and runs them in YOUR language if possible! This also allows you to bypass mandatory gamecard firmware updates.

name: Shuffleshop
headline: Temporarly patches Pokémon Shuffle so all shop itens become free.
author: SciresM
description: This is a method based off of Yifan Lu's spider3DSTools (https://github.com/yifanlu/Spider3DSTools) to make everything in Pokemon Shuffle's shop cost zero jewels.

name: svdt
headline: Savedata manager for ninjhax users.
author: meladroit
description: svdt is a save explorer and manager for the 3DS. It is heavily based on smealum's 3ds_hb_menu/browser and sploit_installer in many parts, and the authors are indebted to smea for making all of his code open-source.

name: RAM2Sav
headline: On-the-fly savefile dumping/injection for Pokémon XYORAS.
author: SciresM
description: This is a method based off of Yifan Lu's spider3DSTools (https://github.com/yifanlu/Spider3DSTools) to dump or inject a save file from your Gen VI Pokemon Game.

name: Agbsave9
headline: Dumps the savefile of the most recently played GBA game.
author: alex34567

name: Save Manager
headline: Savedata manager for ninjhax users.
author: profi200

name: SysUpdater
headline: 3DS offline system updater using CIA files.
author: profi200
description: A quick tool for manually updating a 3DS using CIA files. This is not intended for installing anything else! You also should strictly avoid updating single titles because this also can lead to bricks!

name: UpdateSuppressor
headline: Temporarily suppresses the 3DS update nag.
author: GiantBlargg
description: Pick the app who's update you want blocked using the HBmenu title selector. Program will automatically exit if all goes well. Placing an empty file named halt in the same folder as the program will override this, as well as asking for confirmation before deleting the version record.

name: DownloadMii
headline: Homebrew browser for the 3DS. Discontinued.
author: filfat
description: DownloadMii is a repo based online marketplace for homebrew applications & games.

name: ftpd
headline: FTP server for 3DS. Formerly known as FTBrony.
author: mtheall
description: FTP server for the 3ds, enabling you to easily transfer files to and from your 3ds using a FTP client on your computer. Supports multiple simultaneous clients. The 3DS itself only appears to support enough sockets to perform 4-5 simultaneous data transfers, so it will help if you limit your FTP client to this many parallel requests.

name: FTPony
headline: FTP server for 3DS. Discontinued.
author: smealum

name: Luma3DS Updater
headline: Updater for Luma3DS. Formerly known as "ARN Updater".
author: Hamcha, KunoichiZ
description: A arm9loaderhax.bin updater for Luma3DS (formerly AuReiNand) as a 3DS homebrew (no more SD swaps!)

name: StarUpdater
headline: Homebrew for updating your Luma3DS payload.
author: astronautlevel2
description: This is a simple updater for Luma3DS. It uses LPP-3DS in order to work, and it is available as both a 3DSX and a CIA. NOTE: This is discontinued and will not work with Luma3DS 6.1.3 or newer for menuhax.

name: LumaLocaleSwitcher
headline: Front end to Luma3DS compatible locale system.
author: Possum
description: LumaLocaleSwitcher can be used to manage per-title locales for Luma3ds (and compatible forks such as SaltFW).

name: Flask
headline: WIP Homebrew downloader and updater.
author: TurtleP
description: 3DS CIA Homebrew App Browser. This is purely for Homebrew applications, nothing more. Users will be able to navigate through a nice interface to select downloadable apps. They will also have the ability to donate in various ways to the authors as an option.

name: CIAngel
headline: Download and install good CIAs right on your 3DS.
author: cearp, Drakia
description: Now we can get games directly on the 3DS! Using a Title ID and an encrypted title key, or searching for a title by name, GOOD CIAs will be produced or directly installed that can be redownloaded from eshop and updated from eshop if new content comes out. These CIAs will not interfere with content from eshop.

name: TIKdevil
headline: Batch make and install tickets right on your 3DS at the speed of light.
author: Kyraminol

name: tikShop
headline: Automatically downloads all of the missing tickets for your region.
author: DanTheMan827
description: tikShop is a fork of TIKdevil that has been stripped down to the bare essentials. When you open the app it will download all of the missing tickets for your region and launch the eShop afterwards all without any interaction other than opening the app.

name: tikSweep
headline: Automatically removes any ticket files that are not being used.
author: DanTheMan827
description: tikSweep is a small utility I made that will remove any ticket files that are not being used. It will not delete tickets for any software that is currently installed, nor will it touch any system tickets regardless of their state.

name: installMii
headline: Downloads homebrew directly from their repositories.
author: simonepsp
description: installMii is an easy and fast package manager for Nintendo 2DS/3DS. It is repository based. This means that you can set your own homebrew URL source list and installMii will download packages for you!

name: Diagnos3
headline: Check the functionailty of your 3DS.
author: Technicmaster0
description: It's an app that checks that your buttons etc. work. But this one is completely in 3D!

name: QRWebLoader
headline: Allows CIA installation from QR codes. Deprecated.
author: ksanislo
description: Download and install .cia files at the same time.

name: AutoLoader
headline: Installs a CIA from a URL, then jumps to the installed app.
author: ksanislo
description: Automated 3DS CIA installer/updater that pulls from a URL.

name: OTPHelper
headline: Small tool designed for helping with downgrade and OTP dumping.
author: d0k3
description: A small tool for the 3DS console, for helping with the downgrade and OTP dumping process.

name: eShop Music Changer
tags: utilities, system, customization, shop, ARM11, userland
headline: Changes Nintendo eShop background music.
author: Ptrk25

name: BrewMan
headline: Homebrew repository downloader, with download queue and screenshot support.
author: Cruel
description: Homebrew installer and manager for the Nintendo 3DS. Currently supports only 3dsx homebrew.

name: pokeSlow
headline: Savefile editor for Pokémon Red/Blue/Yellow.
author: zaksabeast
description: Savefile editor for Pokémon Red/Blue/Yellow. It is used in conjunction with PHBankGB. pokeSlow also has an option to convert all pokemon you have saved in the first box of the bank into Slowpokes for no reason besides pure amusement.

name: PCHex
headline: PkHex (Pokémon savefile editor) as a 3DS homebrew.
author: Strackeror

name: PCHex++
tags: utilities, savefile, ARM11, userland, pokémon, pokemon
headline: PCHex rewritten in C++ and with a GUI.
author: Slashcash
description: PCHex++ is a Pokémon savefile editor with a touch-based graphical interface. It is based on Stracker's original PCHex. A lot of code is written from scratch although a lot of ideas are taken from there!

name: PHBank (Pokémon Homebrew Bank)
tags: utilities, savefile, storage, ARM11, userland, pokemon
headline: Free homebrew alternative to PokéBank.
author: Gocario
description: PHBank is a homebrew which allows to manage a local bank for XY and ORAS Pokémon games, just like the Pokébank, but as a free offline service. This homebrew is not intended to cheat (not even cloning). It's just a storage solution.

name: PHBankGB
tags: utilities, savefile, storage, ARM11, userland, pokemon
headline: Pokémon homebrew bank for Pokémon Red/Blue/Yellow.
author: Gocario
description: PHBankGB is a homebrew which allows to manage a local bank for Red/Blue/Yellow, and in the future will handle the japanese titles.

name: The Sharing of Isaac
headline: Share the same The Binding of Isaac savefile between 3DS and PC versions of the game.
author: rinnegatamante
description: The Sharing of Isaac is a sharing savegame system for The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth which will allows you to use a single savegame in both PC and 3DS versions of the game! It can also be used as a cloud space where to save your savegames if you don't own a PC or a 3DS version of the game.

name: VLR Safe Launcher
headline: Makes a backup of your Virtue's Last Reward savefile, then launches the game.
author: lucaboy
description: Virtue's Last Reward for Nintendo 3DS is affected by a critical bug: if you save during an Escape section (especially in the PEC room), the game could crash randomly and you could get the save data corrupted. There isn't any patch to fix this bug (Aksys has only changed the code of the eShop version of the game to prevent players to save in the PEC room). The best way to avoid to lose all of you progress is just to backup your data frequently; VLR Safe Launcher will help you to do it in the faster way.

name: fb43DS
headline: Facebook's chat client for 3DS. Discontinued.
author: linoma

name: MapleIRC
headline: IRC client for 3DS.
author: titegtnodI

name: TWLSaveTool
headline: Savedata manager for Nintendo DS gamecards.
author: TuxSH
description: A 3DS homebrew that allows you to read, write, and erase save files from NDS cartridges.

name: Uncart
headline: 3DS homebrew utility program to dump game cartridges to the SD card.
author: neobrain, archshift, lioncash, normatt, yuriks
description: Ever wanted to backup your 3DS games for usage with Citra, but didn't feel like resorting to piracy-oriented solutions like Gateway? Looking for a less painful way to decrypt game dumps, which doesn't require a gazillion of different tools? Wait no longer, here's uncart! uncart is a tool for dumping 3DS game cartridges. It will dump any 3DS game cartridge to the SD card, from which you can transfer it to your computer.

name: Free Multi Patcher
headline: Apply temporary patches to the system allowing for region free, eshop on lower firmware, etc.
author: hartmannaf
description: This application for the 3DS allows to patch sysmodules while using sysnand or emunand, and with and without using firmlaunch. Because of this it allows eShop access on all 9.x firmware verions and regionfree cias in Pasta and other CFWs.

name: NotifyMii
headline: Homebrew for managing and creating notifications.
author: Ryuzaki-MrL

name: Bird Whisperer
headline: Homebrew for creating custom notifications.
author: ElyosOfTheAbyss
description: Bird Whisperer is a lua program that creates notifications.

name: Non-Stop Nyan Cat
headline: Non-Stop Nyan Cat for Nintendo 3DS.
author: markwinap
description: Smile please :) and use this app at work to help you relieve your stress.

name: DDexter
tags: utilities, LUA, ARM11, userland, Pokémon, pokemon
headline: Pokédex homebrew with a GUI.
author: ddraco
description: This is the first Pokedex created for the 3DS, but at the moment it lacks one thing: the data.

name: DSi Homebrew Menu Loader
headline: DSi Homebrew Menu as a DSiWare CIA.
author: ahezard, ApacheThunder
description: The Homebrew Menu is a simple launcher menu which can be used to replace the menu on several DS flashcards. This menu supports the argv protocol needed for devkitARM compiled applications to make use of nitrofs as well as providing a soft reset feature where applications can exit back to the menu.

name: RomFS Explorer
headline: RomFS file explorer and dumper.
author: Ryuzaki-MrL
description: This is a small homebrew application for listing and extracting files from a mounted romfs drive.

name: Lua Player Plus (lpp-3ds)
headline: LUA interpreter for 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Lua Player Plus 3DS is a Lua interpreter for 3DS/N3DS forked from original lpp-c++ (PSP/PSVITA) trunk made by rinnegatamante and NaNNi. lpp-3ds runs under Lua 5.3.1. It provides different cool features like audio playback, video playback, zip extraction, images loading support, alpha blending, network features, socketing features, etc... It also have an integrated debugger with FTP server support so you can patch your scripts in runtime.

name: ctrµLua
headline: LUA interpreter for 3DS. Part of µLua.
author: µLua Team

name: Cyanogen3DS
headline: An alternative custom GUI for Nintendo 3DS. Port of CyanogenPSP.
author: joel16
description: A WIP Alternative Custom GUI Menu for the Nintendo 3DS, inspired by the design of Cyanogenmod. This is a port of CyanogenPSP running on the 3DS.

name: A9NC (ARM9 Netload Companion)
headline: Receive arm9loaderhax payloads from a PC through the network.
author: d0k3
description: This is mainly intended for devs and gives you a quick, convenient way to get your ARM9 payload to a convenient place on your SD card, and then boot into it.

name: Fake Brick
headline: Simulates a fake blue brick screen.
author: flarn2006
description: Run it on someone's 3DS and it simulates the screen that appears when it's bricked, so you can scare them.

name: FakeBrick9
headline: Simulates a brick during boot (arm9loaderhax).
author: Wolfvak
description: Fool your friends and your families that you have bricked your 3DS! It will boot an a9lh payload named NandUnBricker.bin on the root of the sd card after a few seconds. If you don't have a file named like that, it will just completely frozen at the brick screen simulating a real one. It also need the screen-init A9LH. There's also a hidden easter egg, try to find it.

name: Gateway Launcher
headline: Boots into Gateway Menu.
author: Gateway Team

name: Gateway Menu
headline: Toolkit for the gateway flashcart.
author: Gateway Team

name: Crush 3D Trainer
headline: Trainer for Crush 3D.
author: Team +3DS

name: Pictochat3D
headline: Pictochat clone for 3DS.
author: Tjessx, Ptrk25

name: Koopa Cruiser
headline: A basic homebrew web browser. Hardcoded to open this webpage.
author: thejsa
description: Don't go expecting Google Chrome or anything. This won't even have JavaScript or image viewing or anything for a long time yet, if ever. But it will allow you to view web pages and download files to your SD.

name: 3DS Linux Loader
tags: Loaders, ARM9, ARM11, userland, kernel, arm9loaderhax
headline: Boots into the Linux 3DS port.
author: xerpi
description: Currently the environment is very simple, you have Busybox (which "simulates" some programs like ls, cat, top, etc) and Weston (the Wayland compositor) plus a few Weston clients demos.

name: 3DS Quick Shutdown
headline: Quickly shuts down the 3DS.
author: daxtsu

name: Quick Reboot
headline: Reboots the 3DS.
author: AlbertoSONIC
description: With this app you can quickly reboot your 3DS! You just have to open Quick Reboot app! It also has a security check: if this app gets booted with the L button held, it doesn't reboot. This is usefull if you opened Quick Reboot App by accident or if you want to exit Smash Bros Brawl or Monster Hunter 4 without exiting emunand!

name: Screenshot Tool (scrtool)
headline: Converts ninjhax's raw screenshots to PNG.
author: smealum

name: Screenshot merge
headline: Tool for merging ninjhax and NTR screenshot screens.
author: ihaveamac
description: If you are so lazy and simply want to combine the top and bottom screens of the screenshots you take without using your computer, well here you go. This is screenshot-merge and it does just that: merge every screenshot on your [micro]SD card. The result is a bunch of images in the folder "screenshots-merged". It only asks for confirmation and patience.

name: Scrup
headline: Tool for uploading screenshots taken with ninjhax to imgur.
author: JerwuQu

name: Purgification
headline: Tool for purging notifications.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Purgification allows you to clean and dump (txt + mpo image) your Notifications.

name: TerraInveditThreedee
headline: Inventory editor for Terraria.
author: MarcusD

name: Alarm Clock
headline: Customizable alarm clock for 3DS.
description: A revolutionary piece of homebrew, an Alarm Clock!!! If for some reason you don't have a phone or any other device with waking-up capabilities, you can use this thing!

name: For Anyone Who Walks A Lot
headline: Convers steps into play coins, without the 10 coin per day limit.
author: iamevn
description: The idea is that if you walked a lot in a day and have reached the 10 play coin per day limit, you can just run this little program and it will make up the difference for you.

name: Big Red Menu
headline: CIA installer for legit CIAs.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Big Red Menu is the first CIA manager (installer/uninstaller) for 3DS completely legal and opensource.

name: ORGANIZ3D
tags: utilities, files, multimedia, system, ARM11, userland, kernel, LUA
headline: SD card file manager and media player.
author: rinnegatamante
description: ORGANIZ3D is a filebrowser/multimedia reader/extdata manager for 3DS wrote with Lua Player Plus.

name: Corbenik CFW Updater
tags: utilities, internet, maintenance, ARM11, userland, LUA
headline: Updates your Corbenik CFW payload.
author: gnmmarechal
description: This tool allows you to download the latest version of Corbenik/Skeith CFW to your 3DS directly. It supports different payload paths than arm9loaderhax.bin or arm9loaderhax_si.bin. To do so, check the location of your payload (imagine it is SD:/somedirectory/somefile.bin).

name: 3ds-vgmstream
headline: Stream various videogame audio formats on the 3DS.
author: TricksterGuy
description: This is a port of the vgmstream library for the 3ds. vgmstream is a library for playing a wide variety of streamed audio formats used in video games. As of now this app has a textual interface, though a better interface and more playback features are planned.

name: blargSPC
headline: Play SNES SPC-dumped files on your 3DS.
author: DiscostewSM

name: Y.A.R.U. (Yet Another Regionfree Utility)
headline: Allows for out of region gamecards to be launched on any 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Yet Another Regionfree Utility is a simple version of Regionthree proposed by Smealum in CIA format.

name: Hourglass9
headline: Safe NAND dumper & restorer for use with arm9loaderhax.
author: d0k3
description: Hourglass9 is nothing new - all the functionality found within it is in Decrypt9, too, and possibly was in Decrypt9 for ages. What new it brings to the table is simplicity and (even more) safety. Arm9loaderhax is a prequisite for this, and with it, it is impossible to brick your console with Hourglass9.

name: NinjaCam
headline: Camera without shutter sound.
author: rinnegatamante
description: NinjaCam is an homebrew which allows users to take photos with cameras without playing the default shutter sound typical of Nintendo 3DS Camera.

name: 3DS Multi Hex
headline: Homebrew Powersaves alternative.
author: Metab
description: The purpose is to allow the user with no coding knowledge to modify game saves with hex editing.

name: TinyFormat
headline: Formats system memory without wiping out SD card contents.
author: javimadgit
description: TinyFormat is a small utility to format Sys/EmuNAND without formating your SD card.

name: Downgrade Check
headline: Checks whether your 3DS was properly downgraded.
author: svanheulen
description: This homebrew will check all your installed NAND titles and compare them to the ones that "should" be installed on 9.2.0-20U. It will display any differences when checking but it will also output them to a file called "check.log" inside this homebrew's folder.

name: SafeSysUpdater
headline: Checks all files prior to updating/downgrading your 3DS. Fork of sysUpdater.
author: cpasjuste

name: sysDowngrader
headline: 3DS offline system downgrader using CIA files. Formerly known as PlaiSysUpdater.
author: Plailect
description: A quick tool for manually downgrading a 3DS using CIA files. This is not intended for installing anything else! You also should strictly avoid updating single titles because this also can lead to bricks!

name: NASA
headline: CIA installer for legit CIAs.
author: rinnegatamante
description: NASA is a CIA Manager, based on an heavy modified version of latest source of Big Red Menu, which is compatible with ANY firmware >= 4.1. It uses libSu/libsvchax to get access to required services for LEGIT CIAs installation on fw >= 9.3 and libkhax to get access to required services for ANY CIAs installation on fw 4.1 - 9.2. It also have network installation feature which doesn't need double free space cause it will perform a full network installation.

name: SafeA9LHInstaller
headline: Securely installs arm9loaderhax on your 3DS.
author: AuroraWright
description: It loads all the needed files from the SD card (no more need to build console-specific installers), and it's really fast. Other than that, it's way safer than the original one, as it does various checks.

name: 3DS Remote Desktop
headline: Stream PC screen to 3DS and send 3DS input to PC.
author: retrozelda
description: 3DS Remote Desktop is an app that allows you to remote control your PC for games, movies, porn, etc. It is still fairly rudimentary, but it works.

name: 3DS Wifi Toggle
headline: Turn wifi on or off.
author: daxtsu

name: TWL Slot-1 Launcher
headline: Allows booting blocked DS flashcards on any 3DS.
author: ApacheThunder
description: Many older DS flash carts get blocked by CTR mode (most likely by Process9 of NATIVE_FIRM). You can tell if you see it error almost instantly when trying to boot your flashcart. This app gets around that! Any flashcart that hasn't worked since 1.0 launch firmware can be used with this launcher. Note that some flashcarts may work without this launcher with just the TWL_FIRM patches alone. Test that first before using this launcher.

name: Manga Reader
headline: Download and read mangas on your 3DS.
author: MyLegGuy
description: Pretty much, it lets you read a comic/manga that's stored in a whole ton of image files on your SD card. Oh, and it can also download manga. Sometimes. If it works. There's no zooming, so this thing is kind of bad. If you can live without zooming, maybe you can use this.

name: SOON! (Super cOOl iNstaller)
headline: CIA manager with a nice GUI, language selection and cover art support.
author: Howling Wolf, Chelsea_Fantasy
description: SOON! is a good-looking install-&-delete legal CIA Installer. It is a easy to use CIA installer with "AUTOMATIC" cover selection based in the CIA's unique ID.

name: SOON!2
headline: CIA manager with a nice GUI, language selection and cover art support.
author: Howling Wolf, Chelsea_Fantasy

name: 3DS Paint
headline: Homebrew for drawing using the touch screen.
author: AlbertoSONIC
description: With this app you can draw anything you want, with 7 colors and a rubber! You can find some instructions on the 3DS's top screen!

name: 3DS Motion
headline: Fork of 3DS Paint for making stop-motion animation.
author: norips

name: VN3DS
tags: entertainment, interpreters, multimedia, ARM11, userland, LUA
headline: Visual Novel interpreter.
author: dfsa3fdvc1
description: VNDS is a syntax created for the purpose of playing visual novel games on multiple devices. Dozens of popular visual novels such as Fate Stay Night, Ever 17, Saya no Uta have been converted to be VNDS compatible and thus, when this is completed, will be 3DS compatible.

name: Crimson Scripter
tags: entertainment, interpreters, multimedia, ARM11, userland, LUA
headline: Sound Novel interpreter.
author: phalk

name: 3DSurfer
headline: Basic WAV audio player for 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante

name: Super Simple Calculator
headline: Calculator for simple math operations.
author: CKlidify

name: Graphing Calculator
headline: Simple graphing calculator for 3DS.
author: flarn2006
description: I guess you could say this is the exact opposite of games that run on graphing calculators.

name: Simple Calc
headline: Calculator for simple math operations.
author: GalladeGuy

name: BootCtr
headline: Boot manager. Assign buttons to choose which homebrew to launch (menuhax).
author: m45t3r

name: BootCtr9
headline: Boot manager for arm9loaderhax.
author: hartmannaf
description: BootCTR9 is an ARM9 bootloader for the 3DS System. It's based on BootCTR and its configuration, but with some additional features. It's currently for arm9loaderhax users only, but it should be possible to load it with any arm9payload loader, that allows the loading a payload from offset 0x0.

name: CtrBootManager
headline: Boot manager for use with menuhax.
author: cpasjuste

name: CtrBootManager9
headline: Boot manager for use with arm9loaderhax.
author: cpasjuste

name: Grid Launcher
headline: Fully customizable Homebrew Launcher mod with grid layout.
author: mashers, maorninja

name: Grid Launcher Updater
headline: Updates masher's Grid Launcher to the latest version.
author: ihaveamac

name: DSP Firmware Dumper
headline: Dumps the DSP binary component, needed by many homebrew.
author: rinnegatamante

name: BLEND3R
headline: Model viewer for 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante
description: BLEND3R is a 3D model viewer wrote with lpp-3ds fully opensource. It can be used for benchmark purposes (since BLEND3R allows also stereoscopic 3D and shows current FPS during rendering process) or just for fun. It supports Wavefront (.obj) models but with some restrictions: only triangles primitives, materials are not supported).

name: NVRAM Flash Manager
headline: Wifi NVRAM/SPI Flash dumper/restorer.
author: rinnegatamante
description: NVRAM Flash Manager allows you to dump and restore NVRAM flash which contains some DS Profile infos (For example you can check if your DS Profile is good for 4.1-4.5 DS Profile exploit), Mac Address (probably for TWL_FIRM only), Access Points information and other things.

name: edpJoy3DS
headline: edpJoy client for 3DS.
author: edicpop

name: ZIP3DSFX
headline: Barebones ZIP-based SFX extractor for the 3DS console.
author: d0k3
description:
ZIP3DSFX is a ZIP-based SFX extractor for the 3DS console. It has two main build modes plus multiple configuration options.
SFX Hard Mode: This mode hardcodes the archive.zip into the ZIP3DSFX.3dsx executable. To use this, rename your ZIP archive to 'archive.zip', put it into the data directory and compile with 'make sfx_hard'.
SFX Stub Mode: This mode creates a SFX stub, the actual archive.zip has to be attached to the end of the ZIP3DSFX.3dsx. Compile this with 'make sfx_stub'. Files are attached (on Windows) via 'copy /b ZIP3DSFX.3dsx + archive.zip myZIP3DSFX.3dsx'.

name: 3DText
headline: Simple text file viewer.
author: DarkFlare69

name: 3DS Ebook Reader
headline: A Nintendo 3DS eBook reader.
author: reworks
description: Place books in a folder named "books" on the root of your SD card. Some books can take a while to load! Be patient! Use calibre (google it) to convert other formats to .epub. Make sure its as strict as possible when converting.

name: Font Viewer
headline: View TTF fonts from your SD card.
author: Jwiz33
description: What this simple homebrew does is displays font.ttf from your SD card. font.ttf should be placed in the same directory as the .3dsx and index.lua files. This was made in LUA with LPP-3DS.

name: 3DSident
headline: PSPident clone for 3DS.
author: joel16
description: 3DSident is a tool inspired by PSPident. The tool was used to obtain more information about your PSP's motherboard, firmware etc. Similarly, 3DSident aims to display more information about your 3DS. It is a fork of Wolfvak's ctr_vercheck.

name: Dice 3DS
headline: Simple dice roller made with Lua Player Plus.
author: keanutah

name: Miiverse Custom Image Tool
headline: Allows for custom images to be posted on Miiverse. May result in ban.
author: PF2M
description: This is a custom CIA that spoofs the TitleID of the game and shows an image from the SD card. The amount of CIAs is limited since you need to rebuild it on a per-ID basis.

name: 3DS RAM Dumper
headline: Dumps FCRAM to a file.
author: palantine

name: 3DS Multi Decryptor
headline: Decrypts and creates XORPads for game's ROM files and SD card files.
author: Team VOiD

name: Pokémon Box Dumper
headline: View your Pokémon stats online.
author: seanss

name: PKSM
tags: utilities, internet, savefile, ARM11, userland, pokemon
utilities, internet, savefile, ARM11, userland, pokemon
headline: All-in-One tool for Pokémon games. Formerly known as ECITool, then EventAssistant.
author: BernardoGiordano
description: Savefile editor, wondercard injector and offline homebrew bank for gen4 to gen7 Pokémon games.

name: TinyTot
headline: Two-factor authentication app for the 3DS
author: thejsa
description: This is used for generating One-Time Passwords for logging into websites, similar to Google Authenticator. The secret should be stored in secret.txt in the same folder as the 3DSX, encoded in base32. Currently only supports the TOTP algorithm.

name: CheckMii
headline: Checks which buttons are pressed.
author: Darkrevol

name: Play Coin Setter
headline: Allows modifying the 3DS Play Coin counter.
author: MrCheeze

name: ctr-httpwn
headline: 3DS HTTP-sysmodule exploit for bypassing required system updates.
author: yellows8
description: This is an userland-only exploit for the 3DS HTTP-sysmodule. This allows you to access everything (as of March 22, 2016) that's known to throw sysupdate-required errors on outdated system-versions (the only known exception is browser-version-check since this can't target web-browser httpc currently).

name: Title SMDH Extractor
headline: Extract SMDH from selected title.
author: suloku
description: Press A and the SMDH file will be dumped to the folder of the executable 3dsx file. They are named "high title ID - low title ID.smdh" because using the app name will need to deal with forbidden characters not allowed in fat32 filesystem. Note: there's no feedback when the SMDH is dumped, so after pressing A on a title it would seem as if nothing happened.

name: Tinker
headline: 3DS Homebrew Theme Manager for Shufflehax/Menuhax/Themehax
author: HeyItsJono

name: LOVE
headline: A visual homebrew for Undertale fans.
author: XavyrrVaati
description: LOVE is a visual homebrew. It's an Undertale homebrew aimed at people who played and enjoyed the game, however, LOVE is not a game. It's just a small tribute to the game.

name: SDmounty
headline: Mount/unmount SD card without having to shutdown your 3DS.
author: zoogie

name: MysteryMachine Patcher
headline: Patches Pokémon XYORAS, allowing you to get whatever current Mystery Gift you wish.
author: shinyquagsire23
description: Mystery Machine is a Mystery Gift Spoofing server for Gen VI Pokemon games (XYORAS). It works by spoofing the serial validation and BOSS servers in order to allow the serving of any event desired. The patcher is based on HANS and will dump and modify the code for the Pokemon games in order to redirect them to an alternate server.

name: Homebr3w
headline: Download and install homebrew apps for 3ds easily.
author: Wolvan
description: Does looking up and scanning QR codes annoy you? Wouldn't it be much nicer to just browse through all the existing homebrew apps, installing them with a simple click? Then this app is for you! Presenting: Homebr3w, install or update homebrew on your 3DS.

name: freeShop
headline: Homebrew eShop for downloading CDN content for free.
author: Cruel, arc13
description: Open source eShop clone for the Nintendo 3DS. Allows you to browse and install titles you own (i.e. titles for which you have the titlekey).

name: encTitleKeys Updater
headline: Updater for encTitleKeys.bin for use with freeShop.
author: MatMaf
description: An updater for encTitleKeys.bin for use with freeShop. Based on lpp-3ds.

name: Titlekeys Tools
headline: Updater for encTitleKeys.bin for use with freeShop.
author: Wolvan
description: A tool to easily update the encTitleKeys.bin for freeShop based on lpp-3ds or download the seeddb.bin and decTitleKeys.bin What started out as a fork of MatMaf's encTitleKeys.bin Updater has now been turned into a more all round solution to interact with 3ds.titlekeys.com from your 3ds.

name: HackChat
headline: Homebrew chat application for IRC channel #3dshacks.
author: omikes

name: OpenRegion
headline: Bypass region lock on 3DS.
author: YourNerdyJoe
description: Launch games from any region using the well known DS profile exploit in System Settings.

name: FileKong
tags: utilities, ARM11, userland, files, wifi, LUA
headline: FTP client for 3DS. Supports transferring files from one 3DS to another.
author: rinnegatamante

name: ctroller
headline: Use your 3DS as a gamepad on your Linux PC.
author: phijor
description: ctroller lets you use your 3DS as an input device for your Linux system via the uinput kernel module. It consists of a client that runs on your 3DS, continously streaming the 3DS input data to a server on your PC. The server exposes a virtual device to your system, interpretes the data it receives and writes it to a event node under /dev/input/event* or similar.

name: Orchestrina
headline: Allows you to play songs from many Zelda games. Also has a free play mode.
author: LeifEricson, Ryuzaki-MrL

name: EasyRPG Player
headline: RPG Maker 2000/2003 and EasyRPG games interpreter.
author: EasyRPG Team, rinnegatamante
description: EasyRPG Player is part of the EasyRPG Project. More information is available at the project website: https://easyrpg.org/

name: RayCast3D
headline: Engine for making 3-D games in LUA using the Ray Casting algorithm.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Lua RayCast3D is a 3D Game Engine for Nintendo 3DS which runs under Lua Player Plus 3DS (lpp-3ds). It uses Ray-Casting algorithm (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_casting) to generate a 3D world starting from a 2D map. It runs fullspeed on N3DS with any accuracy value but runs smooth on O3DS only with accuracy values >= 3.

name: LövePotion
tags: Interpreters, engines, LovePotion, LUA, ARM11, userland
headline: Implementation of the LÖVE API for 3DS homebrew.
author: VideahGams
description: LövePotion is an unofficial work in progress implementation of the LÖVE API for 3DS Homebrew.

name: KillerMan: Ghost Buster
headline: Bust ghosts and viruses with KillerMan.
author: Greiga Master
description: This is a fun little minigame based on the Mega Man Battle Network series style of gameplay. You play as KillerMan from MegaMan Battle Network 6 and fight off waves of ghosts and viruses to try to get a high score. The game features stages where you fight sets of viruses and an endless mode where you test how long you can last against an endless wave of ghosts and viruses.

name: Minicraft: 3DS Homebrew Edition
headline: 3DS port of the game Minicraft.
author: Davideesk
description: The goal of the game is to kill the only other sentient being in the world, making sure you'll be alone forever.

name: 3DSCraft
headline: Minecraft clone.
author: smealum
description: 3DScraft is a 3DS homebrew adaptation of the popular game Minecraft. At the moment it is akin to a very basic version of Minecraft's creative mode: you can run around, fly, destroy blocks, place blocks, all in an infinite world generated procedurally in real time. All modifications made to the world are saved to the SD card so that progress isn't lost. Best of all, the game can run in stereoscopic 3D and it looks, like, really cool.

name: 3DS Breaköut
headline: Breakout/Brick Breaker sloppy clone for 3DS. Made with LövePotion.
author: Jwiz33

name: 3DS Pong
headline: A two player Pong game.
author: shinyquagsire23

name: LovePong3DS
headline: Pong clone, built with LövePotion.
author: iKlikla

name: 3DSnake
headline: Snake game for 3DS.
author: Joshtech

name: 3DSnake
headline: Snake game for 3DS. Built with LövePotion.
author: CKlidify
description: 3DSnake is a remake of the classic snake game for 3DS homebrew.

name: Snake 3DS
headline: Snake game for 3DS.
author: Ernilos

name: The Real Snake
headline: Snake game.
author: MichiS97

name: Antibounce
headline: Bounce a ball around and collect coins.
author: TurtleP
description: You play as an infinitely bouncing ball attempting to nab as many coins as possible for a great high score. As the levels increase, so does the speed of the game. The problem is that spikes will appear on a random tile in the map every 5 seconds. At any given time, shields can spawn which protect you from dying once. Beginning on level 4 rockets that home in on you will spawn. Furthermore, gravity itself will flip every so often, so be careful.

name: Asteroids 3D
headline: First person Asteroids clone in 3D.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Asteroids 3D is a "clone" of Asteroids but in a 3D environment so you have to survive as long as you can.

name: Brick Breaker 3D
headline: Breakout clone.
author: FUK-Team

name: EUCLIOD
tags: arcade, shooting, LovePotion, LUA, ARM11, userland
headline: A Bullet Hell shooting game for the 3DS.
author: HexZyle

name: Flappy Pixel
headline: Flappy Bird clone where you control a pixel.
author: ll0rT

name: Helii3DS
headline: Guide the helicopter through a tunnel. Port of Helii homebrew for Wii.
author: BHSPitMonkey

name: Jezzball 3DS
headline: JezzBall/Qix clone.
author: Akdul
description: Jezzball 3DS is a clone of Jezzball for the 3DS, now in stereoscopic 3D! Jezzball is a simple yet addictive game in which you have to fill most of the play area while avoiding bouncing balls. Supports highscore saving.

name: Space Fruit
headline: Asteroids clone with fruits.
author: TurtleP

name: SpaceInvaders
headline: A Space Invaders clone for 3DS.
author: jasonmbrown

name: Tappy Plane
headline: Flappy bird clone where you control a plane.
author: sgowen
description: A lightweight cross-platform Flappy Bird clone for Android, iOS, Windows Phone 8, and Nintendo 3DS! In this game, you tap to control a colorful plane through a cave!

name: Wave
headline: Leads a sinusoidal wave along a scrolling screen and avoid obstacles.
author: yodamerlin
description: Wave is a game of avoiding the incoming squares that are thrown at you from the right of the screen.

name: Whack Mania
headline: 3D Whack-A-Mole game.
author: Zalo
description: It is basically a Whack a Mole game but with very nice graphics similar to Mario Galaxy. Instead of the classic game where the moles appear on holes on a plane here they appear around a planet and you need to rotate it in order to smash them. There are a few other game modes too.

name: 3DS Tic Tac Toe
headline: Tic Tac Toe game for 3DS.
author: AlbertoSONIC
description: With this app you can play at tic tac toe against your friend right on your 3DS!

name: 4Rows
headline: Four in a row/Connect4 game for 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante
description: 4Rows is the port of the "Four in a row'/'Connect4" sample homebrew provided with the very first PSP Lua Interpreter.

name: ASCII Checkers
headline: A version of checkers for the 3DS, in glorious ASCII art.
author: UnsureSherlock

name: Mastermind
headline: Mastermind board game implementation.
author: MrJPGames
description: A version of mastermind for 3DS. Fully functional, the computer generates a random code and you get 7 attempts to crack it. Black pins mean a correct color and correct place, white pins mean correct color but not correct the correct place.

name: Othello 3DS
headline: Othello (Reversi) implementation.
author: MrJPGames
description: The goal is to get the most of your color tile. You can play against your friends or a A.I. opponent.

name: 3DSHangman
headline: Hanging game written in Lua. Port of Hangman for PSP.
author: rinnegatamante

name: 3DS Briscola
headline: Briscola card game written in Lua. Port of PSPBriscola.
author: rinnegatamante

name: Blackjack 3DS
headline: Blackjack/Twenty-one game for 3DS.
author: keanutah
description: Blackjack! Game is played with an infinite deck, with support for late surrender, insurance (2-1), doubling down, and splits. And 3D!

name: DrawAttack
headline: Online multiplayer "guess the word from the drawing" game.
author: Cruel
description: Online drawing game similar to Pictionary. One player is selected to draw a random word while everyone tries to guess what is being drawn. 2-16 players.

name: Guess The Number 3DS
headline: Guess-the-number game for 3DS.
author: FUK-Team
description: The goal of this game is to guess a random number between 1 and 1000 right. The only hint to find the right number is the hint that the number is lower or higher.

name: Simon
headline: Simon musical game for 3DS.
author: mastermodr94
description: The game is fairly self explanitory, It will play you a pattern and you have to follow it. Every turn the pattern goes up by one. The game will keep track of your current session's high score.

name: TriaAl
headline: DeeMo clone for 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante

name: Hax0r
headline: Play as a virus and infect a PowerPC 95.
author: TurtleP
description: Initially this game was made for Ludum Dare 33 where the theme was "You are the monster". In Hax0r, you play as a virus uploaded into an old PowerPC 95 machine and go into various rooms filled with file extension-based enemies. Examples include PaintBurd (image files) and Audioblaster (audio files).

name: Idiot
tags: puzzle, platformer, ARM11, userland, LUA, LovePotion
headline: Help Idiot to escape the dungeon in this puzzle platformer.
author: TurtleP

name: ASCIIJump
headline: A clone of Geometry Dash in ASCII art.
author: JackMacWindows

name: Geomitty Dash
headline: Geometry Dash clone for 3DS.
author: norips

name: Jumping Jack
headline: Port of the ZX Spectrum game of the same name.
author: Zalo
description: The goal is to reach the top. You press Up to jump through floor holes, but be careful not to fall back through them or get hit my enemies.

name: OpenSyobon3DS
headline: Port of Open Syobon Action (Cat Mario).
author: nop90

name: Robin Hood's Platform Game
headline: Simple platform game where you play as Robin Hood.
author: Matthias
description: Single player platform game. Can you defeat Sheriff of Nottingham's henchmen and reach the finish?

name: 100 Boxes 2DS
headline: Remake of the DS homebrew 100 Boxes Puzzle.
author: Cid2Mizard

name: 3-Aldchemys
headline: Little Alchemy clone for 3DS.
author: Gocario

name: 2048-3D
headline: 2048 Puzzle game clone.
author: MrJPGames
description: The goal is to get a tile with a value of 2048. Every tile is a power of 2. You use the arrow keys to move the tiles with numbers, if they collide and have the same value they merge into a double of the first value.

headline: 2048 Puzzle game clone.
author: Mocalacace

name: Aperture Science 3D (portal3DS)
headline: Portal clone for the Nintendo 3DS.
author: smealum

name: Falling Blocks Watch Out
headline: Highly configurable, themeable Tetris clone.
author: Spaqin

name: FillDS
headline: A clone of "Flood It!" for the 3DS.
author: Helreizerdev

name: Loophole
headline: Puzzle platformer where you control "players", which can also be used as platforms.
author: CKlidify
description: Loophole is a single player 2D Puzzle Platformer based on using multiple "players", when you control a player the others are frozen and can be jumped on like platforms. Ported for 3DS by CKlidify. Original game by Korosu.

name: Minesweeper 2DS
headline: Remake of the popular Windows game Minesweeper.
author: Cid2Mizard
description: Minesweeper is a single-player puzzle video game. The objective of the game is to clear a rectangular board containing hidden "mines" without detonating any of them, with help from clues about the number of neighboring mines in each field. The game originates from the 1960s, and has been written for many computing platforms in use today.

name: Paddle Puffle 3DS
headline: Port of Paddle Puffle.
author: Peanut42
description: This game is a port for an already made game (Paddle Puffle). The game is playable, but it still needs some work with texts and intro/finish screens.

name: Picroxx!
headline: The ultimate Picross clone!
author: Substance12
description: Picroxx! is a Picross homebrew clone for the Nintendo 3DS console. It's fully programmed in Lua, running under the LÖVEPotion framework. For those who don't know what Picross is, it's a series of Sudoku-ish puzzle games in which you have to fill up spaces to discover a hidden picture. It gives you numeric hints for each row and column and you have to figure out which spaces to fill, leaving a gap of at least 1 cell between every "line" of filled cells.

name: Pixel Shuffle 2DS
headline: Rearrange the image on the bottom to form the pixelated image on top.
author: Cid2Mizard
description: It is a puzzle game, where you have to drag the columns of pixels on the touch screen to reproduce the pixelated picture on the top screen. It's the adaptation of the flash game "Pixel Shuffle". This version contains 81 levels of the original game.

name: Pixel Swap 2DS
headline: Replicate the pixel image on the top screen on the bottom screen.
author: Cid2Mizard
description: This is a relaxing puzzle game, where you have to reproduce on the touch screen, the pixelated design on top, as soon as possible. It's adaptation of the flash game "Pixel Swap". This version combines Pixel Swap & Pixel Swap 2 and it therefore contains 40 levels in total.

name: Rokoban
headline: 3-D Sokoban clone.
author: Zalo

name: Sokoban
headline: Port of Sokoban puzzle game.
author: Landm

name: TE3DS
headline: Tetris clone.
author: nop90
description: TE3DS is a simple block puzzle Homebrew for 3DS. It's a clone of a well known Russian block puzzle game.

name: Tetris3DS
headline: Tetris clone.
author: UltiNaruto

name: Tetronomino 3DS
headline: Tetris clone, built with LövePotion.
author: CKlidify
description: Tetronomino 3DS is a tetris remake. Ported for 3DS by CKlidify. Original game by Todd Nelling.

name: Bottomless Block Barrage
headline: Panel de Pon clone for 3DS.
author: TricksterGuy
description: Bottomless Block Barrage (BBB) aims to be a Panel de Pon clone for the 3ds. This game is a work in progress but it is currently playable.

name: Super Haxagon
headline: WIP Super Hexagon clone for 3DS.
author: RedHat
description: Super Haxagon is a Super Hexagon like clone for the 3DS! Play as a triangle and rotate to avoid the walls! With awesome background music, get 10 times the amount of entertainment out of your CFW or Homebrewed 3ds (or something like that)! Written in C for the 3ds from the ground up, this game is intended to increase the amount of homebrew games that exist. Enjoy!

name: ThinIce 3DS
headline: Melt all of the ice in a maze.
author: Peanut42
description: The game's objective is to melt every ice space completely on each maze. Port of ThinIce. Original game by Félix Arreola Rodríguez.

name: TileMap 2DS
headline: Adaptation of the puzzle game "TileMap" for the Nintendo 3DS.
author: Cid2Mizard
description: Check you brain abilities in new unusual puzzle TileMap. At each level, you need to locate the tiles in such a manner that their joints will receive a circle of exactly the same color. Replace and rotate the tiles to upbuild the correct map. The larger amount of tiles involved in the game, the more difficult to match them. Remember that at same level you have several correct solutions. You will meet 30 unique levels, where you will spend many hours of gameplay, and even days if you plan to finish the game.

name: Tiles 2DS
headline: Unofficial adaptation of the puzzle game "Tiles".
author: Cid2Mizard
description: Tiles 2DS is a simple yet challenging puzzle game. The goal is to turn all tiles to Yellow side. Tap on a tile to flip it as well as adjacent tiles until the puzzle is solved.

name: The Legend of Zelda: Return of the Hylian
headline: Port of the PC fangame "The Legend of Zelda: Return of the Hylian" for the 3DS.
author: nop90

name: The Legend of Zelda: Oni Link Begins
headline: Port of the PC fangame "The Legend of Zelda: Oni Link Begins" for the 3DS.
author: nop90

name: Insectoid Defense
headline: A Sci-Fi Tower Defense game.
author: sgowen
description: In the distant future, living conditions on Earth are rapidly declining. With not much time left, your team has been tasked with leading an expedition to find a new home. After finding what appeared to be a suitable planet, its inhabitants are now pursuing your star cruiser on the trip home. For now we will call them the Insectoids, a violent alien race. Waves of them are approaching from all directions, and the only way to defend the ship is to deploy your Towers!

name: CS3DS
headline: Port of CSPSP.
author: machinamentum

name: ctrHexenII
headline: Port of Hexen II for the 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante
description: ctrHexenII is a port of Hexen II for 3DS based on a modified version of winQuake. It supports both basic game and Portal of Praveus DLC and it has been tested with glHexenII pak files. Circle Pad and Touchscreen are also supported for player movement by default, there also is second analog support for N3DS and optional gyroscope support for camera movement. There is also a secret third person mode activable on Options Menu.

name: ctrQuake
headline: Port of Quake.
author: MasterFeizz
description: This is a work in progress port of "winQuake" to the 3DS. This only has software rendering for now, so no 3D feature. You can host and also join online servers.

name: ctrWolfen
headline: Port of Wolfenstein 3D.
author: rinnegatamante
description: ctrWolfen is a port of Wolfenstein 3D by idSoftware based on Wolfenstein 3D PSP v.6.0 sourcecode. It runs fullspeed on both O3DS / N3DS in 268 MHZ mode but at this stage it has several bugs and stuffs to add.

name: EDuke3D
headline: Unofficial port of EDuke32 for the Nintendo 3DS.
author: MasterFeizz
description: This is an unofficial port of EDuke32. It is at a playable state, but has some bugs.

name: PrBoom3DS
headline: Port of Doom.
author: elhobbs
description: A version of doom based on prboom 2.5 and code brazenly stolen from dsdoom and other ports. It has 3D and sound - while not exactly perfect it does run. It requires the doom wad files in the root of the sd card as well as the prboom.wad

name: spectre3ds
headline: Port of Quake.
author: elhobbs

name: Shoot ya Friend
headline: Simple 2-player shooter.
author: YourNerdyJoe

name: Turtle: Invaders
tags: shooting, ARM11, userland, multiplayer, LUA, LovePotion
headline: A fixed-axis shooter with netplay and highscores.
author: TurtleP
description: Turtle: Invaders is a fixed-axis 2D shooter where bats come in and it's your job to destroy them. Some will drop powerups that will aid--and some will harm. There are two game modes: Arcade and Endless. Arcade is about getting a general high score based on a small 'story'. In this you'll encounter a mega space bat, raccoon, and a phoenix. Once you've defeated the Phoenix, you win. You can play as various characters who have unique abilities as well. Endless mode is just that--endless. Try and get the highest score possible!

name: Yeti3DS
headline: Port of Yeti3D.
author: smealum
description: Quick and very dirty port of yeti3D for the 3DS. Supports touchscreen, circlepad and 3D.

name: Hamsters 2DS
headline: Hamster breeding game in text mode.
author: Cid2Mizard
description: This is a hamster breeding game in text mode, more precisely a remake of an old windows game. The game uses only the top screen to keep the spirit of the original game.

name: World of 3DSand
headline: World of Sand clone.
author: Steveice10
description: World of 3DSand is a clone of the simulation game "World of Sand" for the 3DS. Right now it contains a decent amount of particle types, with possibly more to come.

name: Reunion
headline: A furry visual novel game.
author: SonyUSA
description: After a bad break-up, you return to your hometown for a week to try and get your life back together. It's been 10 years since you've seen any of your old friends and step-mother, who lives widowed in your father's old house. Features a relationship system and multiple-endings, two main characters to choose from (a male wolf and a female fox) and original character sprites and art by Oli-Snowpaw!

name: Fact Crow
headline: A crow that tells you facts.
author: titegtnodI

name: PixelRoad
headline: Lead a pixel on a tiny road with your stylus.
author: rinnegatamante
description: In this game, you have to guide a pixel with your touchscreen from a start point (green) to a finish point (blue).

name: Shooting Watch 3D
headline: Press buttons as fast as possible.
author: MrJPGames
description: Shooting Watch 3D is a game where you press the A or A and B button as fast as possible! It's based on a handeld with the name "Shooting Watch" made by hudsonsoft!

name: RPS 3D
headline: Rock-Paper-Scissors game written in LUA. Port of RPS PSP.
author: gnmmarechal

name: Undertale 3DS (Tech Demo)
headline: WIP Undertale port.
author: lolzvid

name: Waluigi Simulator
headline: Goat Simulator clone featuring Waluigi.
author: Alerdy
description: Waluigi Simulator is a 3DS game made with Unity for New 3DS, but it is well optimized so far and works fullspeed on an original 3DS too. In the game, you play as Waluigi and run around the mushroom kingdom, ruining things. It is designed to be very similar to the PC and mobile game, Goat Simulator.

name: WANT3D
headline: Super Mario 64 DS "Wanted" minigame clone.
author: rinnegatamante
description: WANT3D is a clone of the minigame "Wanted!" from SuperMario 64 DS (http://www.mariowiki.com/Wanted). You'll have 20 seconds from start, each error gives you -3 seconds and each correct face give you +5 seconds. Instead of Mario (copyrighted) related faces, you'll have some meme faces but you can use your own images by replacing PNG files in faces folder.

name: 3DNES
headline: NES emulator for 3DS. Discontinued.
author: st4rk
description: 3DNES is an NES emulator for 3DS, developed by St4rk and gdkChan. At first, it was just a port from lameNES, but was greatly modified through the reconstruction of the PPU, CPU, modifications on mappers, etc. It doesn’t have support for sound.

name: blargSNES
headline: SNES emulator for 3DS.
author: StapleButter, DiscostewSM

name: Snes9x 3DS
headline: Port of snes9x, an SNES emulator, heavily optimised for the Old 3DS.
author: bubble2k16
description: Snes9x for 3DS is a high-compatibility SNES emulator for your old 3DS / 2DS. It runs many games at full speed (60 fps). It supports games that use CX4 chip (Megaman X2/X3), and the SDD-1 chip (Star Ocean, Super Street Fighter 2 Alpha). It can also play games that use the SuperFX chip (Yoshi's Island, etc) but they run with plenty of frame skips. It has generally much high compatibility than existing SNES emulators on the old 3DS because it uses Snes9x 1.43 as a base, and is a good alternative if your existing emulators cannot play all the games. It also runs faster on your new 3DS!

name: CTR64
headline: N64 emulation research/development for 3DS. Hard fork of CTRX.
author: machinamentum

name: CTRX
tags: PSX, Sony, home console, ARM11, userland
headline: PSX emulation research/development for 3DS. Can't run commercial roms.
author: machinamentum
description: CTRX is a new and free emulator. It has been written from the ground up. It is not a port. It is also free. It has no price and does not bind the user's soul to a document written in legalese. Contributions to the project (including donations) are always appreciated.

name: FCEUMM3DS
headline: NES emulator. Port of FCEUMM. Discontinued.
author: Steveice10
description: FCEUMM3DS is a quick port of the FCEUMM libretro core to the 3DS. The emulator seems to run at near full speed, at least with Super Mario Bros. It isn't quite running at full speed though, which is evident from the choppy sound quality.

name: Vex3DS
headline: Vectrex emulator for 3DS.
author: nop90

name: Z26 3DS
headline: Atari 2600 emulator for 3DS.
author: nop90

name: 3DGB
headline: Gameboy emulator. Discontinued.
author: st4rk

name: 3DSGBemu
headline: Gameboy emulator. Discontinued.
author: seagal112

name: Cinoop
headline: Gameboy/GBColor emulator for 3DS.
author: CTurt
description: A multiplatform Game Boy emulator written in C; currently available for: Windows, OS X, Linux based OSes, Nintendo DS, Nintendo 3DS, Nintendo GameCube, Sony PSP, and Sony PS4.

name: CitrAGB
headline: Gameboy Advance emulator for 3DS. Port of gPSP.
author: shinyquagsire23
description: As of now, compatibility is technically on-par with whatever gpsp's interpreter is able to handle, however, due to the nature of the port some games will not run or crash on particular parts. Flipping the screen to it's proper orientation did a bit of damage which might take a bit to get fixed up, and a lot of things still need implementation. But, on the plus side, many games that do run actually run fairly well, around 50% speed in optimal cases, or as low as 20% if the game uses extremely inefficient idle loops.

name: GameYob 3DS
headline: Gameboy / Gameboy Color emulator with SGB support and high compatibility.
author: Drenn, Steveice10
description: A port of GameYob to the 3DS - a Gameboy / Gameboy Color emulator originally released for the Nintendo DS.

name: Handy 3DS
headline: Atari Lynx emulator for 3DS.
author: nop90
description: An Atari Lynx emulator for 3ds. Port of Handy320 v0.1 for Dingux and OpenDingux that is based upon Handy SDL by SDLemu Team and Handy v0.90 by K. Wilkins.

name: mGBA
headline: Gameboy Advance emulator for 3DS.
author: endrift

name: NeoPop SDL
headline: Neo Geo Pocket Color emulator for 3DS.
author: nop90

name: PokeMini 3DS
headline: Pokémon Mini emulator for 3DS. Port of PokeMini.
author: nop90
description: This is a Pokemon Mini emulator for 3DS. The emulator runs fullspeed on o3DS and n3DS. It runs 72 FPS emulated (36 FPS real with 1 frameskip). This is a port on 3DS of the excellent Pokemini v0.6 by JustBurn.

name: r3Ddragon
headline: A Virtual Boy emulator for the 3DS, based on Reality Boy / Red Dragon.
author: mrdanielps

name: Sim800
headline: CC800 pocket dictionary emulator.
author: banxian

name: 3DeSmume
headline: WIP Nintendo DS emulator.
author: shutterbug2000

name: Phoenix Arcade Emulator
headline: Phoenix Arcade emulator for 3DS.
author: seagal112

name: 3DOS
headline: A port of the 8086 (DOS) emulator 8086tiny to the 3DS.
author: shutterbug2000

name: 3DS-Chip8
headline: Chip-8 emulator for 3DS.
author: st4rk

name: Atari800
headline: Atari800 computer emulator.
author: asie
description: A port of the atari800 8-bit home computer emulator to the 3DS. Remember that this emulator requires Atari ROMs to be present in "/3ds/atari800"! However, Atari allowed the ROMs to be distributed alongside a different emulator, which is now freely available, in 1994. PAL blending may not keep up on an Old 3DS in some cases.

name: Chip8-CTRU
headline: Chip-8 emulator for 3DS.
author: YourNerdyJoe
description: A Chip8 Emulator to 3DS, originally developed by St4rk. Modified and ported to 3DS usermode code by Joseph LoManto (aka YourNerdyJoe).

name: CHIP-3DS
headline: Yet another CHIP-8 emulator for the 3DS.
author: xerpi

name: 3DS Spectrum
headline: ZX Spectrum emulator for 3DS.
author: seagal112

name: Bread Box
headline: Commodore 64 emulator for 3DS.
author: spinalcode
description: Nintendo 3DS port of FrodoDS.

name: ScummVM 3DS
headline: Port of SCUMMVM for the 3DS.
author: Cruel
description: ScummVM is a program which allows you to run certain classic graphical point-and-click adventure games, provided you already have their data files. The clever part about this: ScummVM just replaces the executables shipped with the games, allowing you to play them on systems for which they were never designed!

name: Game & Watch
headline: Unnoficial build of RetroArch's Game & Watch emulator.
author: DogParty

headline: 2048 emulator. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Snes9x 2005
headline: SNES emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Snes9x 2005 Plus
headline: SNES emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: DOSBox
headline: MS-DOS emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Final Burn Alpha 2012: CPS-1
headline: Capcom Play System emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Final Burn Alpha 2012: CPS-2
headline: Capcom Play System 2 emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Final Burn Alpha 2012: NeoGeo
headline: Neo Geo emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: FCEUMM
headline: NES emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: fMSX
headline: MSX emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Gambatte
headline: Gameboy / Gameboy Color emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Genesis Plus GX
headline: Sega Mega Drive emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: gPSP
headline: Gameboy Advance emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: MAME
headline: Multi Arcade Machine Emulator for the 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Mednafen NGP
headline: NeoGeo Pocket emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Mednafen PCE Fast
headline: TurboGrafx-16 emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Mednafen VB
headline: Virtual Boy emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Mednafen WonderSwan
headline: WonderSwan emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Nestopia
headline: NES emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: NX Engine
headline: NXEngine (Cave Story) emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: PCSX ReARMed
tags: SONY, home console, PSX, ARM11, userland
headline: PlayStation emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Picodrive
headline: Sega Mega Drive emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Snes9x 2002
headline: SNES emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: QuickNES
headline: NES emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: Snes9x 2010
headline: SNES emulator for 3DS. Part of RetroArch.
author: libretro

name: CakesFW
headline: Custom Firmware that allows for individual patches.
author: mid-kid

name: Corbenik
headline: Another CFW for advanced users (with bytecode patches!)
author: chaoskagami
description: Corbenik is another CFW for the 3DS somewhat like cakes, but using bytecode-based patches. This allows for doing most of what it does, but taking the control level to its logical extreme. It's mainly intended for developers; so if you don't know your way around the 3DS, chances are this isn't for you.

name: Cosmo3DS
headline: Stripped-down version of Luma3DS.
author: yifanlu
description: This is a stripped down version of Luma3DS that does nothing but load FIRM and emuNAND. It is intended to be used with 3ds_injector to launch a modified loader in FIRM.

name: Luma3DS
headline: Noob-proof 3DS Custom Firmware.
author: AuroraWright, TuxSH
description: Luma3DS is a program to patch the system software of (New) Nintendo 3DS handheld consoles "on the fly", adding features (such as per-game language settings and debugging capabilities for developers) and removing restrictions enforced by Nintendo (such as the region lock). It also allows you to run unauthorized ("homebrew") content by removing signature checks.

name: Palantine CFW
headline: The first public 3DS Custom Firmware. O3DS only.
author: palantine

name: Perfect Bricking Tool CFW (PBT-CFW)
headline: Fork of Palantine CFW without emuNAND support.
author: nop90
description: This is only a simple mod of Palantine CFW without the redirection of NAND R/W to the SD.

name: Pasta CFW
headline: Temporarily patches signature checks on sysNAND.
author: capito27

name: MiniPasta
headline: Minimalistic version of Pasta CFW.
author: d0k3
description: This is a minimalic CFW for the Nintendo 3DS console. It works only via Homebrew Launcher on Firmware versions <= 9.2. It has no EmuNAND, no unneccesary patches, no nothing except signature patching. This is not meant for daily use, but rather for some specific operations.

name: ReiNAND
headline: The original open source N3DS Custom Firmware! Now with O3DS support!
author: Reisyukaku
description: ReiNand started off as a minimalistic custom firmware for N3DS exclusively. At the time, all other open source cfw were O3DS exclusive so it was developed mainly for N3DS. With the shift in standards, support for both was added.

name: rxTools
headline: EmuNAND and SysNAND support. Features a built-in tool menu.
author: roxas75

name: SaltFW
headline: Minimalistic fork of Luma3DS with reduced features to make it more lightweight.
author: Shadowhand
description: Slim Alternative Firmware (SaltFW) is a minimalist and easy to use fork of Luma3DS. Perfect for minimalists, children, and that friend who doesn't know technological stuff!

name: ShadowNAND
headline: CFW that runs from NAND, allowing you to boot your A9LH 3DS without SD card.
author: Shadowhand

name: Puma33DS
headline: Semipro 3DS custom firmware.
author: rboninsegna

name: NTR CFW (BootNTR)
headline: Secondary CFW launched from home menu. Extendable via plugins.
author: cell9
description: Installed as CIA, launched from home menu in CFW. Extendable via plugins. Has support for screenshots, romhacks and streaming the 3DS's screen to PC over wireless on New 3DS.

name: EasyRPG Player Updater: RE
headline: Update easyRPG 3DS to the latest build from the 3DS.
author: gnmmarechal

name: JKSMK
headline: Quick, compact save manager. Fork of JK's Save Manager.
author: ShinyMK

name: QuickSwitch
headline: Quick payload switcher for arm9loaderhax.
author: gnmmarechal
description: It's a tool that switches "arm9loaderhax.bin" or "arm9loaderhax_si.bin" (or anything else, you have to specify in the config file if it is different) with "arm9loaderhax_switch.bin" (or something else, again). It's also capable of renaming "arm9loaderhax.bin" to "arm9loaderhax_si.bin" as to toggle screeinit/noscreeinit behaviour on a compatible A9LH installation.

name: FTPDB
headline: Simple FTP client for 3DS.
author: Favna
description: Supports multiple simultaneous clients. The 3DS itself only appears to support enough sockets to perform 4-5 simultaneous data transfers, so it will help if you limit your FTP client to this many parallel requests.

name: MultiUpdater
headline: Updater for 3DS applications/a9lh payloads.
author: LiquidFenrir
description: MultiUpdater is an updater for a9lh payloads and other files on the SD card. The ability to update CIA applications is planned but has not been implemented.

name: Multidownload
headline: Download files on 3ds by typing links.
author: Pirater12
description: A simple homebrew app for 3DS which downloads the link you type in it and saves to the root of your sd card. Useful for people who have broken cameras and cannot scan QR codes. This program can download all file formats (thats why you can download a 3dsx file also). Now supports official keyboard.

name: Drider
headline: An epub reader for the Nintendo 3DS.
author: ingolemo
description: Drider is a epub reader for the Nintendo 3DS. Put your ebooks in a folder called books at the root of your SD card.

name: Eshop Debugger
headline: Tool used for eshop related stuff.
author: Reisyukaku
description: Parses account information and displays it. Press A to launch eshop.

name: Matrix
headline: All it does is bring up a matrix on the top screen.
author: MagicInventor

name: 3DSPhysics
headline: An application for messing with physics on the 3DS.
author: PieFace
description: This is an application for playing around in an environment with simple physics. Note: This is very work-in-progress and currently has limited features.

name: A9LH Launcher
headline: App for launching arm9loarderhax payloads.
author: kasai07

name: 3dsfetch
headline: Screenfetch for 3DS.
author: VideahGams
description: 3dsfetch is a version of the commonly used Linux ricing script screenfetch, but for 3DS. It's configurable through the config.ini included.

name: Brainfudge
headline: A minimal brainfuck interpreter.
author: V0idst4r

name: Muzik Player
headline: Music player for 3DS.
author: WoniMK7

name: REDThreeUp
headline: IPS patcher for the 3DS.
author: MarcusD

name: PyShell27
headline: Python27 interpreter wrapper for the 3DS.
author: MarcusD

name: 3DS Hardware Test
headline: 3DS Hardware Tester and generic information viewer writen in Lua.
author: ifrit05

name: Wooddumper 3DS
headline: WoodDumper r89 as a DSiWare CIA.
author: shutterbug2000

name: NitroHax 3DS
headline: NitroHax as a DSiWare CIA.
author: shutterbug2000

name: MHX Quest Importer
headline: Homebrew for importing/exporting DLC quest from your MHX save file.
author: svanheulen
description: This homebrew can be used to import/export DLC quest directly from your Monster Hunter X save file. WARNING: This hasn't been extensively tested yet, always make a backup of your save file before importing quests.

name: MHX Data Manager
headline: Save manager for your Monster Hunter X/Generations save file.
author: svanheulen
description: This homebrew can be used to copy characters between different regions of the Monster Hunter X games, backup/restore your save and import/export quests from your save. WARNING: This hasn't been extensively tested yet, always make a backup of your save file before messing with it.

name: Biniax2
headline: Port of Biniax2 for the Nintendo 3DS.
author: nop90
description: Open-source puzzle game by Jordan Tuzsuzov. The gaming field is 5x7 pairs of elements. Every pair consists of two elements out of four possible types (colors). Player is a single element, who can move on empty fields or can take a pair, if the player's element is present in the pair. If a pair is taken, the player's element is swapped to the other element of the pair. The field is scrolling down on time event or after certain moves are spend (depending on the game mode). Game over is when there is no move for the player.

name: Trucmuche 2DS 09
headline: Adaptation of the hidden objects game "Trucmuche".
author: Cid2Mizard
description: Trucmuche 2DS is the adaptation of hidden object "Trucmuche", proposed by the regional newspaper "La voix du Nord" (http://www.lavoixdunord.fr/). This version brings together 49 drawings published in 2009.

name: Cookie Collector
headline: A short Cookie Clicker-like app for the 3DS.
author: Kaisogen

name: Tetrepetete
headline: A lightweight game with blocks.
author: thp
description: This is a 3DS Homebrew port of "Tetrepetete", a game with blocks.

name: That Rabbit Game 3DS
headline: The inverse treasure hunt.
author: thp
description: That Rabbit Game 3DS is a 3DS-specific port of an old DS game, kind of a "inverse duck hunt" where you have to move the flying rabbit head in front of the crosshairs and lose coins. The game also makes use of the accelerometer in the 3DS for movement.

name: Snake2DS
headline: A Snake clone for the Nintendo 3DS. Made with LövePotion.
author: Jacudibu
description: A Snake Clone for the Nintendo 3DS, inspired by oldschool versions of snake like the one on the first Nokia.

name: One Whale Trip
headline: Five-lane underwater whale swimming/pearl pickup adventure game in Python.
author: thp
description: The gameplay consists of the world advancing onto the player front-to-back (as in Skyroads, Desert Bus). Occasional Goodies that the player has to collect and Baddies that the player has to avoid advance on the player as the level progresses. Due to perspective, as objects get closer they get bigger.

name: NumberFucker3DS
headline: NumberFucker port to 3DS.
author: VideahGams

name: Njam3DS
headline: Port of Njam, an open source pacman-like game.
author: nop90
description: Njam ia a pacman-like game well known for it's distributions on linux and has been ported on many platform. It has a lot of levelset and isn't as simply as you may think.

name: Labyrinth 3D
headline: 3D Labyrinth game made with RayCast3D.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Labyrinth 3D is, as the title says, a game where you have to find the exit from the labyrinth you're in. It supports different map sizes and you'll have some scrolls according to map size. These scrolls can be used to "mark" a wall of the labyrinth so you can see where you already went (after marking a wall, it will became golden). Labyrinths are generated through Primm's Algorithm so you'll have infinite random mazes to solve.

name: 3DSudoku
headline: Sudoku game for 3DS.
author: rinnegatamante
description: Sudoku game for 3DS with different difficulties (Easy, Normal, Hard) and a random generator algorithm giving you infinite sudokus to play.

name: 3DS Homebrew Browser
headline: An application browser for Nintendo 3DS Homebrew.
author: zeta0134
description: The homebrew browser allows for easy loading of new homebrew software onto a homebrew enabled 3DS. You should already be able to run the Homebrew Menu/Launcher to run this code. Your 3DS should be connected to the internet for this to work.

name: 3DS HomeMenu extdata Tool
headline: Nintendo 3DS homebrew application for accessing SD extdata used by Home Menu.
author: yellows8
description: This is a Nintendo 3DS homebrew tool for accessing the Home Menu SD extdata, this is usable from ninjhax. This allows reading/writing the home-menu SD extdata SaveData.dat, and the extdata theme-cache. This essentially allows the user to write custom themes to SD extdata, which home-menu will automatically load at Home Menu process next startup.

name: ctr-streaming-server
tags: utilities, wifi, multimedia, music, ARM11, userland
headline: 3DS homebrew audio/video playback server.
author: yellows8
description: 3DS homebrew network server for playing media sent to it from other network devices, and HID reporting over the network.

name: 3DS DSiWarehax Installer
